Soreness, burning and lumps is something you will need to bring up to your doctor who will then probably order an ultrasound of the area. Don't be embarrassed, your doctor has heard of everything. I would have it looked into as soon as possible.

Posts.Title: breast lump

Posts.Content:
I just went through pretty much the same thing however I am 40. I had a mammogram (had one 6 years earlier). They found a lump that wasn't on the previous one. They had me go in for more pics and an ultrasound. Then was referred to a surgeon. She told me it was probably the fibroadenoma but she wanted to be sure. She sent me for a biopsy. Three days later I heard it was not cancerous. The surgeon did tell me that I needed another ultrasound in 6 months to see if it is growing because they can get huge. She said she removed one the size of an orange. Yikes. I'm not sure why they are sending you for more pics though. I did ask my surgeon what would happen if it was cancerous. She didn't really want to get into it much but said we got it early so it would just be a lumpectomy but didn't say anything about
 chemo. Try not to worry too much. I know easier said then done. Let me know how it goes.

Posts.Title: Frustrated with the Doctor

Posts.Content:
I had a biopsy done two months back. You get the results (or you should) within two to three days. I really just tried not to get too worried about
 it until I knew it was something bad. My maternal Grandmother had breast cancer so the thought that I may one day get it is always in the back of my mind. My boys ages 17 and 20 were told what was going on but I said don't worry until there is something to worry about
. It turned out to be nothing to worry about
 but we do have to watch it in case it grows because then it will need to be removed. 
Good luck. Try not to worry too much.

Posts.Title: Biopsy Anxiety--How to Deal with It?

Posts.Content:
Waiting is the worst. Luckily where I go they tell you the results that day. I have a lump that I had a mammo done on and then more films done and an ultrasound. It eventually was biopsied. It ended up being a fiberous adenoma and is not something to worry about
 but if it ever grows large it will need to be removed. So far a year later it hasn't.
Good luck to you. I won't try you not to worry but try not to make yourself sick over it.
